segment.source: Add Device Drivers to Windows During Windows Setup
segment.target: Add Device Drivers to Windows During Windows Setup

segment.source: Add Device Drivers to Windows During Windows Setup
segment.target: Add Device Drivers to Windows During Windows Setup

segment.source: Add Device Drivers to Windows During Windows Setup
segment.target: Add Device Drivers to Windows During Windows Setup

segment.source: To install Windows® on some hardware designs, you may need to add device drivers to Windows Setup.
segment.target: To install Windows® on some hardware designs, you may need to add device drivers to Windows Setup.

segment.source: You can add drivers to Windows Setup by using an answer file that specifies the path to the driver files.
segment.target: You can add drivers to Windows Setup by using an answer file that specifies the path to the driver files.

segment.source: To do this in new installations, you add the Microsoft-Windows-PnpCustomizationWinPE component during the windowsPE configuration pass, add the driver paths, and then specify the answer file.
segment.target: To do this in new installations, you add the Microsoft-Windows-PnpCustomizationWinPE component during the windowsPE configuration pass, add the driver paths, and then specify the answer file.

segment.source: You can also modify existing images and add and remove drivers.
segment.target: You can also modify existing images and add and remove drivers.

segment.source: You can service offline images in several ways.
segment.target: You can service offline images in several ways.

segment.source: For example, you can add the Microsoft-Windows-PnpCustomizationsNonWinPE component during the offlineServicing configuration pass, add or remove the driver paths, and then specify the name of the answer file.
segment.target: For example, you can add the Microsoft-Windows-PnpCustomizationsNonWinPE component during the offlineServicing configuration pass, add or remove the driver paths, and then specify the name of the answer file.

segment.source: For more information about how to modify drivers on an offline Windows image by using an answer file, and also other methods of adding drivers to and removing drivers from an existing image, see Add and Remove Drivers to an Offline Windows Image.
segment.target: For more information about how to modify drivers on an offline Windows image by using an answer file, and also other methods of adding drivers to and removing drivers from an existing image, see Add and Remove Drivers to an Offline Windows Image.

segment.source: Add Drivers to New Installations (windowsPE)
segment.target: Add Drivers to New Installations (windowsPE)

segment.source: For new installations, you add drivers during the windowsPE configuration pass.
segment.target: For new installations, you add drivers during the windowsPE configuration pass.

segment.source: This method initializes Windows Preinstallation Environment (Windows PE) and processes Windows PE settings from the answer file, as follows:
segment.target: This method initializes Windows Preinstallation Environment (Windows PE) and processes Windows PE settings from the answer file, as follows:

segment.source: Windows stages the Windows PE drivers in the RAM driver store..
segment.target: Windows stages the Windows PE drivers in the RAM driver store..

segment.source: Windows loads boot-critical drivers that Windows PE requires to access the local disk and network.
segment.target: Windows loads boot-critical drivers that Windows PE requires to access the local disk and network.

segment.source: When you right-click DevicePaths and select Insert New PathAndCredentials into Windows PE, Windows PE processes other Windows PE customizations that the answer file specifies.
segment.target: When you right-click DevicePaths and select Insert New PathAndCredentials into Windows PE, Windows PE processes other Windows PE customizations that the answer file specifies.

segment.source: The Windows Setup process applies the Windows image.
segment.target: The Windows Setup process applies the Windows image.

segment.source: Boot-critical drivers appear on the Windows image before Setup installs that image.
segment.target: Boot-critical drivers appear on the Windows image before Setup installs that image.

segment.source: Other drivers that you added to the Windows PE driver store appear in the Windows image driver store.
segment.target: Other drivers that you added to the Windows PE driver store appear in the Windows image driver store.

segment.source: When Windows Setup processes the offlineServicing pass, Windows Setup also adds any drivers that the driver path specifies to the Windows image driver store.
segment.target: When Windows Setup processes the offlineServicing pass, Windows Setup also adds any drivers that the driver path specifies to the Windows image driver store.

segment.source: To add a device driver during the windowsPE pass
segment.target: To add a device driver during the windowsPE pass

segment.source: Use Windows System Image Manager (Windows SIM) to create an answer file that contains the paths to the device drivers that you intend to install.
segment.target: Use Windows System Image Manager (Windows SIM) to create an answer file that contains the paths to the device drivers that you intend to install.

segment.source: Add the Microsoft-Windows-PnpCustomizationsWinPE component to your answer file in the windowsPE configuration pass.
segment.target: Add the Microsoft-Windows-PnpCustomizationsWinPE component to your answer file in the windowsPE configuration pass.

segment.source: Expand the Microsoft-Windows-PnpCustomizationsWinPE node in the answer file.
segment.target: Expand the Microsoft-Windows-PnpCustomizationsWinPE node in the answer file.

segment.source: Right-click DevicePaths, and then select Insert New PathAndCredentials.
segment.target: Right-click DevicePaths, and then select Insert New PathAndCredentials.

segment.source: A new PathAndCredentials list item appears.
segment.target: A new PathAndCredentials list item appears.

segment.source: For each location that you access, add a separate PathAndCredentials list item.
segment.target: For each location that you access, add a separate PathAndCredentials list item.

segment.source: You can include multiple device driver paths by adding multiple PathAndCredentials list items.
segment.target: You can include multiple device driver paths by adding multiple PathAndCredentials list items.

segment.source: If you add multiple list items, you must increment the value for each path.
segment.target: If you add multiple list items, you must increment the value for each path.

segment.source: For example, if you add two separate driver paths, the first path uses the value of , and the second path uses the value of .
segment.target: For example, if you add two separate driver paths, the first path uses the value of , and the second path uses the value of .

segment.source: Save the answer file, and then close Windows SIM.
segment.target: Save the answer file, and then close Windows SIM.

segment.source: The answer file must resemble the following example:
segment.target: The answer file must resemble the following example:

segment.source: Boot to Windows PE.
segment.target: Boot to Windows PE.

segment.source: At a command prompt, run Windows Setup.
segment.target: At a command prompt, run Windows Setup.

segment.source: Specify the name of the answer file.
segment.target: Specify the name of the answer file.

segment.source: For example:
segment.target: For example:

segment.source: Windows Setup adds the device drivers in the serversharedrivers path to the system during the setup process.
segment.target: Windows Setup adds the device drivers in the serversharedrivers path to the system during the setup process.

segment.source: For more information about drivers, see Device Drivers and Deployment Overview and Add a Driver Online in Audit Mode.
segment.target: For more information about drivers, see Device Drivers and Deployment Overview and Add a Driver Online in Audit Mode.

segment.source: For more information about Windows components, see Unattended Windows Setup Reference.
segment.target: For more information about Windows components, see Unattended Windows Setup Reference.
